Half-Square Triangle Magic

Need a Walkthrough?

You can create 2, 4 or 8 half square triangles
starting with 2 larger squares of fabric.
Benefits: Less sewing, less trimming, uniform half-square triangle units.
Get Started:
  1. Begin with 2 squares of fabric, right-sides facing, same size, and of different color/pattern.
  2. For the dotted lines, you will sew 1/4 an inch from the drawn lines or edges.
  3. For the solid drawn lines, you will cut, preferably using a clear ruler and a rotary blade.
  4. After your cuts - Press. Trim dog ears. Trim down to size, keeping the 45° angle.
Take out some scraps and practice!

Traditional (2 HSTs) Method

Quad (4 HSTs) Method

Octo (8 HSTs) Method

Let's get started!

Use this form below to calculate the finished block size per HST method.

The result is rounded down to the nearest 1/16th
assuming you will trim the final blocks to the same size.
All values below are in inches.
